Constructor Detail

AdaptiveAccounts

public AdaptiveAccounts()
                 throws FatalException,
                        SSLConnectionException
Constructs the AdaptiveAccounts object which has wrapper APIs for AdaptiveAccounts Web Services.

Use this constructor when the paypal_sdk_client.properties and paypal_sdk_headers.properties files (which contain API_BASE_ENDPOINT, proxy server name, port and credentials respectively) are available at the default location. The default location for example in case of Tomcat server is tomcat_directory/bin/config

Throws:
FatalException
SSLConnectionException

AdaptiveAccounts

public AdaptiveAccounts(java.lang.String clientFile)
                 throws FatalException,
                        SSLConnectionException
Constructs the AdaptiveAccounts object which has wrapper APIs for AdaptiveAccounts Web Services.

Use this constructor to override the reading of the property file from its default location. To know what properties are needed paypal_sdk_client.properties included in the\samples\commandLine\config can be referred.

Parameters:
clientFile - Absolute path of the paypal_sdk_client.properties file which contain API_BASE_ENDPOINT, proxy server, SSL certificate location, SSL is used or not, API Credentials, etc.
Throws:
FatalException
SSLConnectionException

AdaptiveAccounts

public AdaptiveAccounts(java.util.Properties clientprops)
                 throws FatalException,
                        SSLConnectionException
Constructs the AdaptiveAccounts object which has wrapper APIs for AdaptiveAccounts Web Services.

Use this constructor to supply the properties using Properties Objects created by you. This constructor can be used in situations where properties files are encrypted. Use your own logic to read the encrypted properties and load them as Properties Objects. To know what properties paypal_sdk_client.properties included in the \samples\commandLine\config can be referred.

Parameters:
clientprops - Properties object which contain the properties API_BASE_ENDPOINT, API Credentials, proxy server, SSL certificate location, SSL is used or not, etc
Throws:
FatalException
SSLConnectionException
See Also:
AdaptiveAccounts
